ygData.subject: RE: The thrill of being a bard: was sonorous clounding message
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I have dropped my claw a few times and never lost it. It can be hard to spot as it is viewed head-on, ie it looks like several metel dots. Sorry about your
ygData.messageBody:
>From: "Blair, Keith (Keith Blair)" <kblair@...>
>Subject: RE: [eqbards] The thrill of being a bard: was sonorous clounding
>message
>Date: Tue, 31 Aug 1999 12:52:24 -0600
> > I'll start a Troll Shaman or something. Lotta fun.
>
>I've got an Ogre Shaman - it's a very close tie as
>to which is more entertaining between that and my
>half-elf Bard. My Bard can get into cities though,
>so that keeps me playing him.. That and at level 14,
>the mana consumption of a Shaman is very high and
>results in boring medding times that we don't have
>to go through with our Bards.
>
> > Thulian Claws the other night and they're LORE.
> > They were destroyed before they hit the ground
> > - 700pp flushed.
>
>I'm not sure what happened to you here, but I've
>dropped my Dragoon Dirk (LORE) and picked it up
>again. Being LORE simply means that you can't
>own two of them. Your claws should have been on
>the ground where you dropped them. Maybe not very
>visible - but still there.
>

I have dropped my claw a few times and never lost it. It can be hard to spot
as it is viewed head-on, ie it looks like several metel dots.
Sorry about your loss


Rokenn Swiftsong - Karana server
Master Craftsmen of Societus Argenti
